summary.para: Specifies the word wrapping to be used in a particular multiline paragraph.
summary.div: Note DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING_EMERGENCY_BREAK, DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING_WHOLE _WORD, and DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING_CHARACTER are available in Windows 8.1 and later, only.

member.name: DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING.DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING_WRAP
member.summary: Indicates that words are broken across lines to avoid text overflowing the layout box.

member.name: DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING.DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING_NO_WRAP
member.summary: Indicates that words are kept within the same line even when it overflows the layout box. This option is often used with scrolling to reveal overflow text.

member.name: DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING.DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING_EMERGENCY_BREAK
member.summary: Note Windows 8.1 and later only.Words are broken across lines to avoid text overflowing the layout box. Emergency wrapping occurs if the word is larger than the maximum width.

member.name: DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING.DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING_WHOLE_WORD
member.summary: Note Windows 8.1 and later only.When emergency wrapping, only wrap whole words, never breaking words when the layout width is too small for even a single word.

member.name: DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING.DWRITE_WORD_WRAPPING_CHARACTER
member.summary: Note Windows 8.1 and later only.Wrap between any valid character clusters.
